thread.title: North Korean Cheerleaders: 100 Olympic Stars Are Born - WSJ

author: Joshua Robinson
title: North Korean Cheerleaders: 100 Olympic Stars Are Born - WSJ
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—The first night of Olympic short-track speedskating in this skating-mad country was always going to be crazy. Then the North Korean cheerleaders showed up.
The unified Korean team opened its medal account on Saturday as Lim Hyo-jun took gold in the men’s 1,500 meters before a frenzied hometown crowd in the Gangneung Ice Arena. That much was expected: South Korea is the most dominant short-track nation on the planet.
